comments:
Build ID: 3.3 M5 (I20070209-1006)

This is on Linux GTK2 x86_64.

Steps To Reproduce:
A vanilla eclipse with empty workspace doesn't have the problem, but it happens with my particular workspace. So might be hard to reproduce.

More information:
Splash shows, but no progress is shown. The .log in metadata says:

Perhaps because handles are longs on x86_64?

PW
Does Eclipse continue to start after this happens?
If the handles are longs we're going to need to change the SWT APIs.  The shell constructor only accepts an int.

It looks like it's one of these:

int /*long*/ handle

They pre-process on the x86_64 platform to make them longs :-)

Later,
PW

The actual size of the handle will vary according to platform, it basically needs to hold a pointer, on the 64 bit platform, this may actually be more than an int.

Silenio had said something about longs on gtk, but I only see ints in the interface.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Does Eclipse continue to start after this happens?
> 
Yes it does continue to start, there is just no progress bar.

Fix for this is in HEAD and should be in nightly builds on or after March 1.  We're now calling internal_new reflectively and treating the handle property according to what version of the method we find.  

J?rg, I've verified it works on 32 bit platforms but I'd appreciate it if you could verify that it works for you on x86 64.
This seems like something that could have been detected before it went into the build.
There are still issues with this on 64 bit machines.  Sigh...
Fix in HEAD.  Sorry for this mess.

Hooray, I can see progress now ;-)

For some reason, the actual progress bar was shown only upon 3rd startup or so (splash now always showed image and progress text, though).

The progress text is shown with an ugly gray and opaque background, is that intended?
mmm no. could you please log a new bug and attach a screen shot?
